The Lover's Kiss Presided over by a choir moogle, this ceremony is conducted in a light-hearted fashion and is sealed with a kiss.
The Spinner's Hand Presided over by a female Officiant of the Graces, this traditional ceremony dedicated to the Twelve concludes with a symbolic toast to mark the start of your lives together.
The Solemn Oath Presided over by a male Officiant of the Vows, this undenominational ceremony closes with the signing of an official pact before the assembled guests.

If you are being harassed by another player, whether it be verbally or play-related, submit your claim here.

If you believe someone is using a program which gives him/her an unfair advantage, or have witnessed the buying, selling, or bot-driven farming of items using real currency, you may submit a claim here. Please note that we are unable to provide individual responses to reports.

If you believe you have discovered a bug, you may submit a report here. When reporting on gameplay issues, always confirm with Lodestone FAQs and the online manual before submitting. Please note that we are unable to provide individual responses to reports.

Please submit any in-game support-related feedback or suggestions here. Please note that we are unable to provide individual responses to feedback and suggestions. Feedback and suggestions regarding FFXIV can be posted on the official FFXIV General Discussion forums.

PvP (player versus player) duty involves battles fought against other players rather than in-game creatures and incorporates an independent battle system with its own set of unique rules. FINAL FANTASY XIV offers several different varieties of PvP, from ranked matches to casual training for anywhere from 2 to 72 participants.
For more information on PvP, visit the Lodestone─the official player's site for FINAL FANTASY XIV.

Members with personal chambers can now be discharged from free companies. Any items kept within the chambers can be reclaimed by speaking with a resident caretaker.
You can now change the color of your stabled chocobo's plumage by feeding him snacks.
You can now purchase land for a private estate. Speak with a resident caretaker for a detailed explanation on the steps required.
Subdivisions have been added to all three residential districts. There are now double the amount of plots available for purchase. Travel to the subdivisions is possible via Aethernet shards.
You can now use expansion of duty permits, allowing the dispatchment of retainers on estate property. Speak with a resident caretaker for a detailed explanation on the steps required.
You can now use aetherial wheels. Charge wheels on wheel stands and convert the stored energy into company actions. Speak with a resident caretaker for a detailed explanation on the steps required.

You can now add a company workshop to your estate. Workshops can be used to craft company projects such as aetherial wheels, housing materials, and airships. Those airships can then be deployed on exploratory voyages. Speak with a resident caretaker for a detailed explanation on the steps required.
A new attraction─the Lord of Verminion─is now available in Chocobo Square!

The following changes have been made to housing:
- Estate sharing is now available with private estates. - The brightness of estate lighting can now be adjusted. - Estates not accessed for extended periods of time will be automatically demolished and the plots of land put back up for sale.
For further details on these changes, speak with a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>resident caretaker<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

Exploratory missions are now available through the company workshop's <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>voyage control panel<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. These missions allow you and your company members to explore a remote cluster of islets in the Sea of Clouds known as the Diadem.
For further details, speak with the mammet voyager #004A.

Flowerpots and flower vases are now available for placement in all private estates and chambers. Curious crops grown in the flowerpots can be exchanged for materials at residential area material suppliers.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Apartments<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are now available for purchase in residential areas. Speak with a resident caretaker for details.

The following activities have been added to the Duty Finder and are accessible under Gold Saucer:
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Triple Triad Battlehall Matches<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>LoVM Player Battles (Non-RP)<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>LoVM Player Battles (RP)<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>LoVM Tournaments<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Lord of Verminion match registration no longer requires MGP.

The following features have been added to estate orchestrions:
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Playlists<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Play All option<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Repeat option<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Shuffle option<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Further information on playlists can be found under the active help topic “The Orchestrion.”
Caught fish can now be placed in <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>aquariums<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and displayed in estates or private rooms.
Paintings are now available for purchase at the Hard Place in Idyllshire. These paintings can be placed in frames and displayed in personal estates, rooms, and apartments.

New exploratory missions are now available through the company workshop's <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>voyage control panel<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. These missions allow you and your company members to explore a remote cluster of islets in the Sea of Clouds known as the Diadem.
For further details, speak with the mammet voyager #004A.

A <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>relocation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> option is now available to estate owners wishing to move to a new plot of land. In addition, owners will now be granted use of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>storerooms<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for the temporary storage of both outdoor and indoor furnishings. Speak with a resident caretaker for details.

Unsure what to wear to the coming seasonal event? <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Glamour dressers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> have been added to inn rooms in all of Eorzea's major city<var 1F /var>states and Kugane, making gear coordination even easier!

Custom <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>PvP teams<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can now be formed! View the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>team creation board<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> located on the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Wolves' Den Pier<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to learn more!

The following temporary <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>restrictions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> have been placed on future land purchases:
・All new land purchases are limited to <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>free companies<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. ・Players may only own one private and one free company estate per <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>World<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> per <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>service account<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. ・Free companies with less than <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>four members<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> cannot purchase land.
Plots relinquished by owners will be unavailable for purchase for a limited time.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Message Books<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can now be found in all estates and apartments. Callers can now leave personalized messages, as well as <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>like<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> the estates.

The following duties have been added to the Duty Finder under “Gold Saucer”:
Chocobo Races <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Random<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Sagolii Road<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Costa del Sol<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Tranquil Paths<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Chocobo Races (Party Member) <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Random<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Sagolii Road<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Costa del Sol<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chocobo Race: Tranquil Paths<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

A new Gold Saucer Active Time Event “Leap of Faith” is now available!
To coincide with this addition, the GATE schedule has been updated. Speak with the Gold Saucer attendant at Entrance Square for details.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Mannequins<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are now available for all residences and can be purchased from housing area merchants, estate man/maidservants, hokonin, or housekeeping nodes. Players can use mannequins to display gear, as well as sell it to prospective buyers.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Tags<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can now be attached to all residences and viewed in the following areas:
Estate Profile Ward Select Screen Private Chamber Select Screen Apartment Room Select Screen
Achieving a maximum satisfaction level with <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Zhloe Aliapoh<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will now allow you to apply glamours to the budding shopkeep.

A new Gold Saucer Active Time Event “Air Force One” is now available!
To coincide with this addition, the GATE schedule has been updated. Speak with the Gold Saucer attendant at Entrance Square for details.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Nautical maps<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can now be discovered on certain subaquatic voyages to reveal the whereabouts of additional explorable locations.

A new Gold Saucer Active Time Event “The Slice Is Right” is now available!
To coincide with this addition, the GATE schedule has been updated. Speak with the Gold Saucer attendant at Entrance Square for details.

A new stage has been added to the Gold Saucer Active Time Event “Leap of Faith”!
To coincide with this addition, the GATE schedule has been updated. Speak with the Gold Saucer attendant at Entrance Square for details.

You may now try on gear from the Online Store via the Dreamfitting feature. Access Dreamfitting from the bed in any inn room to try on everything from full outfits to individual pieces, and let your dreams run wild!

When residing in an inn room, you can now choose to cast glamours using items not only from your inventory, but also those stored in glamour dressers or armoires.
Retire to private chambers, and switch up your style in comfort!

<var 48 F20202 /var>Progress Record<var 48 01 /var> Progress within the latest Savage raids is periodically saved, allowing for continuation of the duty from that point.
Progress is reset every week on <var 06 1203 /var><var 09 DD ((Sunday)) ((Monday)) ((Tuesday)) ((Wednesday)) ((Thursday)) ((Friday)) ((Saturday)) /var> at <var 08 DB ((<var 09 DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C /var>)) 0D /var> <var 08 E0DB0D ((p.m.)) ((a.m.)) /var> (Earth time).
<var 48 F20202 /var>Party Progress<var 48 01 /var> A party's starting point in the raid is determined by the leader's past progress. As long as all other conditions are met, players who have not progressed as far as the leader may still participate in the duty.
If a party member's progress was less than that of the leader, then progress will be updated to match.
If a party member's progress is beyond that of the leader, that member's progress will remain unaffected.
<var 48 F20202 /var>Reward Restrictions<var 48 01 /var> Players will not earn rewards for completing phases they have already completed. Coffer quantity will vary based on the total number of party members who have already completed the duty.
When participating in the latest Savage raid with a matched party, duty rewards may change based on the progress level of matched members.
<var 48 F20202 /var>Job Distribution<var 48 01 /var> Parties formed with the Raid Finder do not allow for two members with the same job unless certain conditions are met.
DPS jobs are divided into the following roles: Melee DPS, Physical Ranged DPS, Magical Ranged DPS, and Not Specified.
When the raid purpose is set as “Duty Completion,” the jobs that fall into Not Specified must be different from the ones which fill the other three DPS roles. When the raid purpose is set to “Practice,” overlapping between specified and unspecified DPS jobs is allowed.
<var 48 F20202 /var>Loot Rules & Languages<var 48 01 /var> Loot rules and Language settings are imported from current Duty Finder settings.
<var 48 F20202 /var>Penalties<var 48 01 /var> Penalties for withdrawing from duties are shared between all matched content.

You have received an invite to the Novice Network from the <var 12 4F /var>mentor <var 29 EA02 /var>!
The Novice Network is a place where beginning players can share their experiences and pose questions on adventuring to participating mentors. Be sure to take full advantage of this channel, but also remember to be polite and respectful while doing so!
ビギナーチャンネルに参加しますか？ ビギナーチャンネルは一度参加した後でも、 以下の方法で退出することができますので、 気軽に参加してみてください。 <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>ビギナーチャンネル参加者リストの「退出」ボタンを押下 テキストコマンド「/**** off」を実行<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Once an invite to the Novice Network has been declined, participation in the channel will not be allowed until another invite is received.
Click the box below to automatically decline all further invites.

Once the Novice Network has been left, participation in the channel will not be allowed until another invite is received.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>※Leaving the Novice Network does not remove the New Adventurer/Returner status.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Much and more has happened in Eorzea while you were away. To help those such as yourself reacclimate to the ever-changing realm, the Twelve have prepared a most generous boon─the Returner's Bounty.
Accepting this divine aid will provide you with the tools required to make that quick return to form, including experience bonuses for partying with <var 12 4F /var>mentors, as well as full access to the Novice Network, a chat channel dedicated to lending a helping hand.

All <var 12 60 /var>Returners are granted full access to the Novice Network. In addition to returners, this chat channel is only open to <var 12 4F /var>mentors and <var 12 4E /var>new adventurers, and provides players with a place to ask questions and seek help.
The Novice Network can be left at any time by pressing the Leave button in the Novice Network List, or by using the text command <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var><var 28 ((TextCommand)) F0E109 /var><var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Declining the Returner's Bounty will remove the Returner status. Returner status cannot be reachieved without first meeting several requirements.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Proceed?

Mentors can rejoin the Novice Network at any time by using the text command via the Novice Network List or by using the text command <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>/novicenetwork on<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

To organize a custom match, you must have two light or full parties willing to participate. Once invitations have been sent, the leader of the Claws can continue the registration process by pressing the Join button.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>※Spectator parties must have at least two members. ※Invitations for spectator parties cannot be sent until participating parties have been formed. ※When organizing a custom match, the leaders of the participating and spectating parties must be in the same area. ※Undersized party settings are ignored in custom matches.
※The following will cancel match registration: ・A party leader leaves the area ・A party leader is changed ・A party member logs out ・A new member joins a party ・A member leaves a party ・A party is disbanded ・A party declines the match registration ・The “Cancel All” button is pressed <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Due to revisions being made to the PvP system, this duty is temporarily unavailable. Further announcements will be made in upcoming patch notes or similar.

The following changes have been made to Savage duties: ・Progress records are no longer kept for individual duties. ・The “Progress” option is no longer available. ・Two treasure coffers will always appear upon completion. ・The weekly limit on items from treasure coffers has been removed.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Matching Requirements<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The “Duty Complete” option is only available for previously completed duties.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Purpose<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The “Duty Completion” option is only available if the weekly reward has yet to be obtained.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Practice Phase Selection<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> This is only available when “Purpose” is set to “Practice.” Practice phase selection does not entail the actual skipping of phases.
If the registration period overlaps with the weekly reset, registration will be canceled.

Progress within the latest Savage duty is periodically saved, allowing for continuation from that point.
Progress is reset every week on <var 06 1203 /var><var 09 DD ((Sunday)) ((Monday)) ((Tuesday)) ((Wednesday)) ((Thursday)) ((Friday)) ((Saturday)) /var> at <var 08 DB ((<var 09 DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C /var>)) 0D /var> <var 08 E0DB0D ((p.m.)) ((a.m.)) /var> (Earth time).

Players will not earn rewards for completing phases they have already completed.
Coffer quantity will vary based on the total number of party members who have already completed the duty. ・1-4 players = 1 coffer ・5 or more = No coffers
When participating in the latest Savage raid with a matched party, duty rewards may change based on the progress level of matched members.

Parties formed with the Raid Finder do not allow for two members with the same job unless certain conditions are met. ・DPS jobs are divided into the following roles: Melee DPS, Physical Ranged DPS, Magical Ranged DPS, and Not Specified.
When the raid purpose is set as “Duty Completion,” the jobs that fall into Not Specified must be different from the ones which fill the other three DPS roles. When the raid purpose is set to “Practice,” overlapping between specified and unspecified DPS jobs is allowed.
Parties formed with the Raid Finder do not allow for more than one pure healer and one barrier healer. ・Pure Healers: White Mage, Astrologian ※Emphasis on actions that directly heal self and party members. ・Barrier Healers: Scholar, Sage ※Emphasis on actions that negate damage via magicked barriers.

A party's starting point in the duty is determined by the leader's past progress. As long as all other conditions are met, players who have not progressed as far as the leader may still participate in the duty.
If a party member's progress was less than that of the leader, then progress will be updated to match. If a party member's progress is beyond that of the leader, that member's progress will remain unaffected.
* Not all unfulfilled requirements are displayed.

This treasure coffer has been marked by the Gambler's Lure! Should you wish to try your luck, two cards will appear─one hidden, one revealed─with a possible value of one to nine. You must then guess whether the value of the hidden card is higher or lower than that of the other. ・If you guess correctly, the quantity of items you may claim will increase. ・You may elect to try your luck again following a correct guess, up to a maximum of five times. ・If you guess incorrectly at any point, the coffer will vanish, and you will lose all treasure. ・If the number is the same, the quantity of items you may claim will remain unchanged, and you will have to try your luck again. This will not count against the five-time maximum. ・To claim the treasure within, you need only resist the Gambler's Lure and open the chest...

Use the board not only to create your very own PvP team, but to view information on how teams are formed and rated.

PvP teams are adventurers who, rather than have their companions chosen at random, join together to take on Crystalline Conflict and other PvP duties in custom-made parties of their own creation.
To create a PvP team, the following conditions must be met: ・Only a party leader can create a team ・Members cannot be part of another PvP team ・Parties must have 4-6 members (cross-world allowed) ・All members must have unlocked PvP ・Players on free trial accounts are not allowed ・All members must have Home Worlds in the current data center

Team rating is a numerical value that indicates the relative strength of a PvP team. This value will increase or decrease based on performance in ranked matches. To register for a PvP team-specific ranked match, a party of 4 members from the same PvP team must first be formed.
Team rank is determined by a team's current rating. Rank will rise and fall as the team's rating does.

“Season” is the term used to indicate the fixed period of time during which official team and solo PvP matches are held. Only participating in ranked matches during a season will contribute to your PvP rating. Teams which end the season with the highest rankings are awarded special prizes. Team ratings and rankings are reset at the end of every season. Season schedule and ranking information can be viewed under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>PvP Team<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

Team information, including status of current members, can be viewed under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>PvP Team<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

To invite a player to a PvP team, target him or her and select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Invite to PvP Team<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommands. The invitee will join the team upon agreeing to the request. To invite someone from another World server to your PvP team, you must first be in a cross-world party with that player.
Dismissing a member of your PvP team is conducted in the same manner as invitations, except <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Dismiss from PvP Team<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is chosen from the subcommands after targeting the player.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>* Only PvP team leaders or subleaders may invite and dismiss members.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Certain team actions, such as changing the team name or updating the team crest, require authorization to execute. This authorization is only granted to team leaders and subleaders. A team subleader can be appointed by the team leader via subcommand on the member list in the PvP Team interface.

To disband a team, the leader must first select the option <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Disband Team<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> found under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Status<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> on the PvP Team interface. More than half of the team members must then agree to the disbandment before it is executed.
To leave a PvP team, a member must select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Leave Team<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, also found under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Status<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> on the PvP Team interface. Once the team has been left, that member will no longer have access to functions associated with the former PvP team.

If a leader is not online for more than 90 days (including cases where the character has been deleted), the PvP team's subleader will be automatically promoted to leader. If the team does not have an appointed subleader, the title of leader will be assigned to the member who joined the team first.
A PvP team will automatically be disbanded if no members log in for more than 90 days (Earth time).

<var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Cross-world linkshells<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are special linkshells that allow players on different worlds to form private chat groups and communicate in real time. Any player can create a cross-world linkshell, as well as join one via invite. While communication between players on the same world is possible through cross-world linkshells, it is recommended that intraworld communication is done using normal linkshells available in Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, and Ul'dah.
Cross-world linkshell channel order can be changed via list subcommands. This information is saved to the client, so if you plan on utilizing multiple play environments, it is highly recommended you save the data using the settings backup feature.
Please note, players may belong to up to eight cross-world linkshells at a time, and linkshells with less than 2 active members will be automatically disbanded if new members are not added within 24 hours (Earth time). Multiple cross-world linkshells cannot be created in succession.

<var 08 E4E80203 (( <var 48 F20202 /var>Data Center Travel System<var 48 01 /var> The Data Center Travel system is an extension of the World Visit system, and allows you to temporarily visit Worlds in other data centers. Certain restrictions apply to data center travel, including those dictated by the World Visit system.
<var 48 F20202 /var>Visiting Other Data Centers<var 48 01 /var> ・Until you have returned from visiting another data center, you may not log in or perform other actions with characters in your Home World. ・You may only travel to other data centers from your Home World. If you wish to travel to a data center different from the one you are currently visiting, you must first return to your Home World and submit a Data Center Visit request from there. ・When logging out from another World, you will automatically be returned to your Home World if you do not log in again within 30 days. Depending on the timing of your last logout, you may be returned after more than 30 days have passed.
)) (()) /var><var 08 E3E80203 (( <var 48 F20202 /var>World Visit System<var 48 01 /var> The World Visit System allows you to travel from <var 08 E4E80201 ((your Home World)) ((the World you are currently visiting)) /var> to different World servers within the same data center. While visiting different Worlds, you may party with friends, purchase items, tackle duties, and more.
<var 48 F20202 /var>Visiting Other Worlds<var 48 01 /var> ・Depending on the congestion of the target World, travel may take several minutes. ・Once preparations have been completed, travel will occur automatically and cancel all current actions/duties. ・When logging out from another World, you will automatically be returned to your Home World if you do not log in again within 30 days. Depending on the timing of your last logout, you may be returned after more than 30 days have passed.

Adjust the resolution of UI assets. Certain HUD widgets, windows, or action icons may change according to the settings selected. ※A reboot is required before changes are applied.
Standard Render UI assets with HD or Full HD resolution settings.
High Render UI assets with WQHD or 4K resolution settings.

Dynamically scale the resolution of individual render targets to reduce GPU workload and maintain a consistent frame rate.<var 08 E4E94F03 (( ※When NVIDIA DLSS is selected, graphics upscaling will be processed automatically. ※A target frame rate may still be selected.)) (()) /var><var 08 E4E94F04 (( ※A target frame rate may still be selected.)) (()) /var>

Adjust the quality of graphics scaling. Improve performance by choosing a value between 50% and 100%.<var 08 E4E94F03 (( ※When NVIDIA DLSS is selected, graphics upscaling will be processed automatically.)) (()) /var>

Choose between NVIDIA or AMD graphics upscaling.
NVIDIA DLSS (Deep Learning Super Sampling) Uses deep learning technologies to upscale lower resolutions to desired display settings. ※A GeForce RTX graphics card is required to enable this setting.
AMD FSR (FidelityFX Super Resolution) Uses advanced upscaling technologies to upscale lower resolutions to desired display settings.
Adjust the detail of 3D objects based on their distance from the camera. Maintain visual quality and improve performance through simplified rendering of distant character models and backgrounds.
Causes grass to move and sway in response to character movement.
Enable or disable the reflection of light and objects on water, floors, and other surfaces.
Adjust colors to blend the outline of objects and background images, smoothing out jagged edges for improved visual quality and performance.
When set to normal, uses simplified lighting to reduce graphical load and improve performance.
Adjust the display quality of grass that appears in the environment.
Uses parallax mapping to give the appearance of depth and definition in textured surfaces.
Uses tessellation to improve the appearance of water surfaces.
Enable or disable reflective glare on water surfaces.
Enable or disable the display of shadows. Settings can be adjusted by category for optimal performance.
Maintain visual quality and improve performance through simplified rendering of distant character shadows.
Maintain visual quality and improve performance through simplified rendering of distant background object shadows.
Adjust the resolution of textures used to render shadows.
Adjust the distance over which shadows will be rendered. Higher settings offer more realistic visuals, but impact performance.
Soften the edges of shadows to create a more natural aesthetic.
Adjust the resolution of textures used for characters and backgrounds. ※A reboot is required before changes are applied.

Adjust texture filtering settings.
Anisotropic Uses sampling to ensure the proper appearance of textures on screen relative to the camera angle.
Trilinear Smooths the transition between different texture resolutions while accounting for depth.
Bilinear Calculates the average color for adjacent pixels to create more natural textures.
Adjust settings for anisotropic filtering. Higher values will result in smoother textures.
Adjust settings for movement physics. Settings can be adjusted by category for optimal performance.
Darkens the edges of the screen, drawing focus toward the center.
Creates a blur effect emanating from the center of a given point of origin on the screen such as an explosion.
Renders natural shadows for objects in close proximity to create more realistic visuals.
Adjust the intensity of light refracting or reflecting off surfaces.
Adjust the wavering distortion effect of scenery when viewed underwater.
Creates a blurred effect for objects and scenery beyond the camera's point of focus. ※Depth of Field is only applicable in cutscenes and when using group pose.
Adjust the level of detail used for distant objects and light reflections.
Select the main display. When multiple displays are connected, the primary display will be determined by your system settings. ※A reboot is required before changes are applied.

Select a desired screen mode.
Windowed The application shares available main display space with all running applications.
Borderless Windowed The application shares available main display space with all running appplications, but covers the entire screen.
Full Screen The application has exclusive control of the main display.

Set the display resolution for the game.
Presets Includes a list of pre-determined resolutions supported by your main display. When Full Screen is selected, the main display's refresh rate will also be applied.
Custom Freely adjust the width and height of the screen's resolution. ※Only available when Windowed is selected.

By default, HUD elements do not scale with the resolution of your screen, which may result in the UI appearing disproportionately small at higher resolutions. This setting allows you to select a suitable level of UI scaling relative to your desired display resolution. ※When a lower resolution is selected, scaling will be adjusted automatically.

While the size of individual HUD elements and windows can be freely adjusted, this setting determines their initial display size. Selecting “Apply All” will reflect these changes in all UI elements, including those already displayed on the screen.
Adjust the brightness of the game's display so that colors appear correctly on-screen.
Adjust the brightness of your character's personal lighting.

Adjust the game's frame rate limit.
None The frame rate is uncapped, increasing to the extent your system is capable.
Main Display Refresh Rate Sets your main display's refresh rate as the frame rate limit.
60 fps Sets the frame rate limit to 60 fps.
30 fps Sets the frame rate limit to 30 fps.
Limits the game's frame rate when using another application while the game client is open but inactive.
Limits the game's frame rate when the game client is active, but your status is “Away from Keyboard.”

Complete all of the tactical exercises for a special reward!
Upon completing these exercises, you will receive brand-new gear for your chosen role as well as the brand-new ring, which increases EXP earned by 30% until level 30.

As your level rises, you will face greater combat challenges with all manner of dangerous enemy attacks. These exercises are designed to arm you with the knowledge you'll need to survive. Upon completing them, you will receive the neophyte's ring, which increases EXP earned by 30% until level 60.
